law.text: The secretary, with the approval of the Governor, may enter into cooperative agreements with appropriate agencies of the federal government, whereby Acts of Congress and regulations issued in pursuance thereof affecting the employment of labor within this state may be administered, supervised, inspected, and enforced by the cabinet. Similar agreements may be entered into by the secretary with the approval of the Governor, for the cooperation of federal agencies in the enforcement of state laws whose enforcement is vested in the secretary.
law.history: Amended 2010 Ky. Acts ch. 24, sec. 1711, effective July 15, 2010. -- Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. sec. 1599c-14.
